Reviews.Title: Not bad(then I found a tip, and I rate it very good)UPDATED
Reviews.Author: Mark Fellows "Gadget Guy"
Reviews.Content: Updated this review on April 18th, 2012 Look Below >>>>>>>>>>I have had this tv for a few weeks.  The choice was between this one and a cheaper Panasonic that had lots of good reviews. When I went to the store, I expected to buy the Panasonic, but this one seemed to have a better picture.  The clincher was the sound quality.  This one was much better.  I could actually hear this one, but the other one sounded muddled. Maybe the speakers were blown on the Panasonic, but I couldn't hear it.  Since I have a wood pellet stove, there is a lot of background noise in my living room, so I needed good sound.  This one has some equalizing scheme that allows it to sound better at lower volume. Perhaps Toshiba pumps up the gain on the highs which makes it easier to hear.As for the picture, it is fine.  Not near as bright as my friends TV of the same size that cost over twice as much, but okay for what I want it for, which was primarily to watch netflix at 480P.When you first hook up the tv, it asks you if you want to take it out of "store mode"  Which is why it looked so great to start with... I guess it pumps up the brightness, and contrast so it looks great in the store, and makes people want to buy it.It isn't quite as bright as it looked in the store, but it is fine.I don't regret my purchase, and as long as it turns out to be reliable for years to come, I will be satisfied with my purchase.I could use some separate composite inputs.Overall, it is fine.I increased the rating of this TV to 4 stars after I found the following EXTREMELY HELPFUL TIP ON A BEST BUY REVIEW posted by USofANDY."The picture looks excellent, however, I did need to make a lot of changes to the menu settings to achieve this - the picture is too dark at default settings but the two key settings to remedy this are the energy saver settings and backlight intensity.Turn off energy saving and crank up the backlight and you have a very bright picture, the remaining settings can be easily calibrated to your preference.Make no mistake, I love the picture quality and the screen itself has low reflection."The picture was always nice, but the first thing I noticed was that it was a little dark.  I didn't like it, but could tolerate it.  Turning that energy saving mode off, made a HUGE difference!  Now I have a nice bright picture, which looks much better.I am really glad I found that tip by chance, and I hope you find the tip either on Best Buy, or here on Amazon.That one little tip made me give it another star.  Now I am completely satisfied...James Ruffin Says:"1. Hit the menu button,2.go to "preferences" in the menu3. press the down arrow key to scroll down (the energy settings are sort of hidden at the bottom),3. hit the enter button to select energy savings4. Set auto brightness sensor to "off"Picture should be much brighter. "

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations!
Reviews.Author: Tom O.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 32" LCD TV as a "slick deal" recently, which means I found it at an uncommonly low price, and purchased it on a whim.Out of the box, I was pleased to learn that the picture quality was going to FAR exceed my expectations. I have discerning taste, and I can say with a clear conscience that the picture quality of this set is on par with what I've seen from Sony & Samsung. The black is black, the contrast is great, and the colors really pop. It is truly a stunning picture! And completely unexpected from a set of this price range (and brand name).I read reviews that disparaged the sound quality before I received the TV - but I was pleased to learn upon setting it up that the sound quality was fine. It's average, mind you, but not terrible. I have it currently set up in a 14 x 23' carpeted & fully furnished family room and it sounds fine. I just wish it had an "analog audio-out" port so I could hook up one of my subwoofers to it.Besides the picture quality, the HDTV antenna reception was an unexpected surprise. It's outstanding! I don't have an antenna connected to the TV, yet it pulls in every local channel that I get on my other LCD TV (that has a highly rated Leaf antenna connected to it)! In fact, this Toshiba TV provides BETTER reception than my other TV. None of the channels "come in and out." They just work, all the time, clear as day, in high def.  Pretty impressive stuff! [In the spirit of full disclosure, my other LCD TV is a few years old and might not have a great tuner. So maybe all LCD TVs have great in-the-box reception these days. Take my feedback for what it's worth.]All in all, I'm very impressed with this set from Toshiba. I never would have purchased one of their sets if I hadn't gotten such a good deal on it, but now I've opened my mind to their TVs. They certainly did a good job with this one! Particularly around the picture quality and over-the-air HDTV reception.Quite impressive for this price range.

Reviews.Title: I am mostly happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: L. K. Sterling "voice of gabriel"
Reviews.Content: The picture is very sharp and it is much better than I expected for the price.But I have one big complaint and one smaller one.The small complaint is that the remote is oddly designed.  Some frequently used buttons are very tiny and poorly labeled.  The mute only goes to half mute when first pressed.  If I wanted to turn the TV down, I'd turn it down.  I expect the mute button to mute the TV.The large complaint is that the audio is not very bright.  The maximum sound level is barely enough for me to hear over my fan or when I am cooking.  If you like to watch TV loud or if you are putting it in a large room with background noise, you will be disappointed. I am going to have to buy some external speakers.  I am not a gamer and don't care about extra bass--I want a crisper sound in the midrange/human voice levels.  I keep rewinding to hear what is said during movies and dramas when conversations are soft.  News shows and game shows are OK.That said, the picture is very sharp.  It is my first HDTV so I have nothing to compare it to but the picture is very nice, and I was expecting to pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: Great for a bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: reviewer88 "reviewer88"
Reviews.Content: Got this television for my bedroom because my old television broke. I was tossed up between this television, and the Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C3, and picked this. At the time there was a negligible difference in price, under five dollars difference. This was a great deal for a tv that is barely used. The main reason I picked it was the screen the panasonic had was an IPS screen, after looking online, although I had trouble understanding the specs, the info led me to believe this is brighter as it has a different style of screen.(Wikipedia IPS and CCFL) The picture is crisp and sharp and the sound is fine for a bedroom, it is currently more than loud enough On half volume at 10 feet away. The only cons I had was I had to screw the stand on to the television, and the remote feels cheap, although it works well. The USB function does not play video for me so it was essentially useless, and the screen defaulted at 4:3 and I had to set it to 16:9 so the image would fill out the screen. I know I am nitpicking because all the cons with the exception of the remote were easily solved. In the end there are televisions better than this one, but not at this price.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for Kids or Bedroom
Reviews.Author: James Ruffin "jrstriker12"
Reviews.Content: After my old CRT TV died in my bedroom, I was looking for a decent TV with a good match of features and value. I didn't need anything fancy since I use it to watch news/weather/traffic in the morning or as a TV for my daughter to watch cartoons. I am very happy with this Toshiba as it has a good set of inputs, a decent picture, and a reasonable price ($250).Anyone buying this TV should read the review by Mark Fellows. You have to turn off the auto brightness sensor to get a sufficiently bright picture (see instructions below) or keep it in "retail" mode. I took off one star for the frustration of trying to find the energy saving options.  Turn off the auto brightness sensor and you'll be more than pleased with the picture quality.How to turn off the auto brightness sensor:1. Hit the menu button,2.go to "preferences" in the menu3. press the down arrow key to scroll down past the REGZA-LINK options (the energy settings are sort of hidden at the very bottom, off-screen),3. hit the enter button to select energy savings4. Set auto brightness sensor to "off"Picture should be much brighter.

Reviews.Title: Great value so far
Reviews.Author: Dino Saur
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV to replace a 27-inch tube that blew. We've had it a week and we're pretty happy so far. We bought it in June 2011 at HH Gregg in Myrtle Beach after reading online reviews. Paid $270 inclusive. We'll be using it as our main set in the living room, primarily to watch cable tv. It is comparable to the 27" tube we had; just wider. If money was no object we might get a slightly larger one but it is adequate for our needs. I have a larger, older projection model I'll be setting up in another room for football.  Picture and sound are both very good for this price point. Sound is not overwhelming but this type tv doesn't have much room for speakers. We live in an older house with a good-sized living room and it's plenty loud. Movies might be a problem since the jacks ("ports"?) don't match my old dvd player. There's no yellow jack and hooking yellow to other jacks yields a black&white; picture. Guess we'll have to buy an "S video" or "HDMI" cable. That's all Greek to me; I'm a Triceratops. But I'm sure something can be worked out. It would be nice if Toshiba had included a manual to explain this sort of thing. As noted elsewhere, it takes its own sweet time changing channels, so if you're a channel-surfer you might want to look elsewhere.I was concerned over reports that models like this one with fluorescent backlighting/edgelighting (as opposed to LED) might be difficult to view from extreme angles off to the sides. I checked this out in the showroom and at home and I don't find this to be a problem at all. Unless I'm standing next to the tv, I can see just fine from any angle or distance.  Setup was pretty easy. The stand screwed right on and I only had to make about four or five choices on the setup menu and the scanning began. About ten minutes later we were watching tv. Five minutes later we had our two universal remotes synched to it. Speaking of remotes, for some reason you have to press the button twice to mute the sound. First push just yields half-mute(?)  We can't speak to durability but I was reassured to find that Toshiba recently merged its LCD screen production with Sony and Hitachi in some sort of Japanese gov't.-sponsored deal. This model comes with a one-year parts & labor manufacturer's warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great balance of economy and quality
Reviews.Author: Lee M. Roller
Reviews.Content: I am extremetly happy with this set.  I have had its' 40" companion model 40E220U in my living room for several months so I already had a pretty good idea what I was getting.  I actually purchaed two of these.  One for the master bedroom and one for a guest room.  I have found this line of Toshiba sets to be affordable with a very good picture once set up properly.For those who have complained about the picture I think it is only fair to point out that the proper settings on ANY television make all the difference.First, as has been mentioned in other reviews, turn off the auto brightness sensor.  Under the preferences menu scroll all the way to the bottom, past the Regza-Link control option to the Energy Savings Settings (this item is scrolled off the bottom of the screen initially  below the Regza-Link option).  Select that item and turn the auto brightness sensor off.  You will immediately see the picture brighten.Next make sure the basic adjustments in the Picture menu are set well.  Go into the Picture menu and try the following range of settings.Set the Picture Mode to 'PREFERENCE' (you probably set it to STANDARD in the initial quick setup)Go into the picture settings and try the following range of values play around with them since there are small varaiances beetween sets and between environments...CONTRAST  90 to 96BACKLIGHT  90 to 96BRIGHTNESS 55 to 58COLOR  45 to 50SHARPNESS  5 to 8As I said, play around with it a bit to suit your room and your taste but I find these settings to be very satisfying and the calibration disk I use bears out that they are as they should be.One other note, you will need to repeat the picture settings for each input.  Antenna, HDMI1, HDMI2, PC...they all have their own settings that the set "remembers".  This is good if your cable or satellite box gives a "hotter" picture than your DVD, unless of course you are running all your switching through an AVR (which I do in the living room, however  my DirecTV and my BluRay look equally good on the same setting on HDMI1)

Reviews.Title: Great Value/Great Television!
Reviews.Author: A. Hansen "AH Booklover"
Reviews.Content: My son wanted a bigger television for his bedroom but we refused to spend too much on a kids television.  This was a "cheaper" television but it turns out we were actually really pleased!  The set up was easy, it was an easy set up with the xBox, and the picture is super!  The speaker sound is as good as to be expected when you don't have a home theatre system set up.  But, this is in a bedroom so the sound is perfect.  I cannot find a thing wrong with this or any reason to be unhappy.  This is the first Toshiba we have owned, and I would consider this brand in the future!

Reviews.Title: Better than good, But not great.
Reviews.Author: CaliNative
Reviews.Content: I am in college now(as a freshman) so i had to buy a new tv, which is a must-have for any dorm room. For $220 and free shipping, the TV got to my dorm the same day i arrived, and it was not damaged in anyway, (it was fulfillment by Amazon). I read a few reviews previously about this tv and how it has sound problems and doesnt always turn on. All i have to say is that i disagree with everything that read.In my opinion the sound could be better, but it really doesnt matter, i mean if you need it at 87 to hear it perfectly then thats what you leave it at, there is a reason why it can go up to 100. Although i dont even need it to be that high, i actually keep it around 15-18 when going to sleep, so i dont keep anyone up at 3am, and i can hear everything fine. but during the day i usually have it at around 30-40 just because i like my stuff loud. I will say that i actually like the mute button because the first time you press it it only halves your volume. But everyone that is complaining about it needs to chill out, i mean all you have to do is press it two times, i mean your finger is allready on the button, HOW LAZY CAN SOME PEOPLE BE!!!Also, you definetly need to change the brightness settings by taking the energy saver off. it makes an incredible difference to the picture quality. I used to have a vizio which is a great tv and Always has great reviews, and i think that this tv has pretty much the same quality as my other hdtv. so the two things that actually matter about the tv are actually great for the price.The only thing i dont like about this tv is that the remote is retarded, it only has two hdmi ports, and it does not have picture in picture mode. My vizio had it, so i was really bummed that it did not have it on the toshiba. However The tv does have a favorites button which i have never seen before. (in college there is no cable box, so it is cool to have a favorites button on the actual tv itself).I would definetly choose to buy this tv again if i could go back in time.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture; Easy Setup; Perfect First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Vishmandu "Born To Shop"
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV and replaces a Toshiba 19" color CRT TV that's about 15 years old (and still worked as good as new).  We watch TV only for the occasional DVD or national emergency, etc., so our requirements are very low, maybe 1 or 2 DVD's a week, tops.  We just leaned how to stream movies from Youtube and Hulu so we might increase our viewing, but seriously, who has the time?  Anyway this Toshiba HDTV was a super buy from our perspective.  It allows direct hookup of a laptop, and has a USB input, so we can view digital camera photos right off the SD Card; really convenient and absolutely the best way to show photos to friends. The picture looks amazing to us, which you might expect coming from a much older analog CRT display, but we compared this to a Panasonic and a Samsung, which were much more expensive and no better picture.  Another advantage to this relatively smaller screen is the unit can be lifted with one hand.  We store the TV behind an antique Victor crank victrola that sits in front of a picture window, looking out on the Appalachian mountains.  We did not want the TV to spoil the view, so it sits on the floor behind the victrola till needed, then I just lift it off the floor onto the victrola cabinet and we're ready to view.  When done I just put in back on the floor and cover it with the foam dust cover it shipped with.  The poor man's hidden HDTV setup.  I had to rig a strap using two of the wall bracket mounting bolt holes on the back of the unit; no problem.  It's almost too easyWe have a DVD player and a VHS player piggy backed onto the composite video inputs, which seems to work fine.  I used "Y" connector RCA plugs, two female in to one male out.  There does not seem to be any loss in picture quality, but we don't have an HDTV DVD player.  It just puts out 480dpi so there's not a lot of HD to be lost.  There really is some advantage to not being spoiled with super high def expectations.  I find the control easy to understand and use, with the most frequent adjustment being for picture size.  This is a button on the control you just keep pushing and it rotates the picture through the various sizing options till you stop at the one you like.  This feature is also nice when displaying digital camera photos.  The sound quality and volume is good.  You may get some buzz with high volume of really dynamic sound, but you can use the audio capability through the RCA connectors and run it to a stereo system.  We haven't found the need.  We sit about 12 feet from the screen in a fairly large room and are delighted with the viewing.  Remember we are coming from a 19-inch CRT, so it doesn't take much to beat that.I'm sure we are using this unit at the lower end of its capabilities, so I am not describing all its more sophisticated features.  HDMI will be used for displaying streaming through a Macbook, but I haven't gotten around to get that implemented.  The signal from my PC laptop through a 20-foot VGA cable is just great, using the VGA input port on the unit and a separate stereo sound patch cord from the headphone output of the laptop to the same connector input on the Toshiba.  You have to tell the TV to use the PC input and analog sound but that is an fairly easy menu access and adjustment.Overall a good TV and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic no-frills HDTV
Reviews.Author: KaneRobot "kanerobot"
Reviews.Content: This is right near the top of HDTV's I've seen as far as bang for the buck. While they don't throw in a lot of the bells and whistles (ie built in apps, tons of connection options), I wasn't looking for any of that. I just wanted a bedroom TV that looked good and was affordable. This is about as good as it gets in that regard.While it is only 720p, it is highly unlikely anyone really needs 1080p at a size of 32". Unless you're sitting with your nose on the screen, there isn't really going to be a difference. Blacks are excellent, very close to LED quality. It even includes a VGA input, which is becoming more and more rare for the less expensive sets. Between 2 HDMIs, one component, one VGA, and the antenna, I'm more than satisfied at this price.TV cosmetically looks fine, no annoying lights while the TV is operating and no ridiculous "touch of color" style stuff like you see on Samsungs (nothing against Samsung TVs, but I hate how the ToC style looks).Admittedly the built-in sound is kind of "meh," but again, at this price I'm not expecting theater quality out of my speakers. The built-in speaker is fine for your run of the mill TV watching if you're just watching Simpsons reruns or whatever, but if you're settling in for Game of Thrones or Band of Brothers reruns you're probably going to left wanting if you're just going through the TV speaker.Also, off angles are not the best compared to other recent HDTVs I've seen. They are not awful, but this is something you're going to want to be sitting pretty straight on in front of. Pic begins to look a tad washed out as you move to the left and right.Despite those minor qualms, highest possible recommendation. I'd advise getting the warranty, as due to the low cost of the TV itself, the warranty is very cheap as well (around 30 bucks).Couldn't be happier with this purchase so far (about 2 weeks in)....just be sure to turn off that auto brightness thing (sort of hidden under the energy saver settings in the preferences menu) as soon as you set it up. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: worked great... for an hour
Reviews.Author: Kevin O'Brien
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few TV's in its price range that had VGA/PC audio input jacks, and i used it accordingly for a bedroom setup with a media center PC.  Worked great for about an hour, but then the top 40% of the screen started bleeding white colors upwards into the bezel, and the very bottom had a bright blue line going across the screen.  The box was undamaged, and the tv itself had no visible issues, so I might have had a dud (manufacture date was july 2012, so no help there either).  To be certain, I disconnected the VGA/PC inputs and used an HDMI input instead for a different device (xbox360), and same results.  After reading through the reviews I also noticed one other issue that a few people were having: the remote would only work intermittently despite having a new set of batteries in it.  Back it goes, very disappointed but props to Amazon's great return policy.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba LCD TV 32C120U - less than a year old and already dead
Reviews.Author: horsegirl2013
Reviews.Content: I did not get this TV from Amazon, but from Best Buy, and I just want to put my review up for people thinking about purchasing one. I bought this less than a year ago and was happy with it until a couple of weeks ago. I got home from work, turned it on, and there was sound but no picture - the screen was black. After about 5 minutes, the picture finally came on, so I went through the manual and reset everything, to try to keep it from happening again. The next day, and for about a week and a half, it was working fine. Yesterday, it was doing the same thing - turn it on, and there is sound but no picture. The picture eventually came on last night, but this morning, I turned it on, and again there was sound and no picture. The picture has not come on at all today. Go figure, I am not sure where I put the receipt for this, so I am probably out of luck. I guess I will be hooking my old tube TV back up in the living room - about 15 years old and still works, unlike the les than year old Toshiba. Bottom line - don't buy this TV!

Reviews.Title: Decent Value
Reviews.Author: Nutterbutter "Sam"
Reviews.Content: Positives: price ($237); quality; picture, and the assumption that the Toshiba name means it will hold up longer than a Coby at same price.Negatives: reaction speed (changing channels, turning on); DVD inputs; remote (button placement, size, illumination)Basically, I have similar comments to other reviewers (see above) - I would have rated this TV a 5 based on price, but gave it a 3 because I cannot believe that any engineer/designer would design a TV that most people will use in bedroom with a remote that does not light up and has small buttons.

Reviews.Title: Great name brand TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Prime Customer
Reviews.Content: Just received it from Amazon and received it quickly.Plugged it in and turned it on and it worked perfectly. The TV is very light which is also a great feature as this is for the kids room and am not worried about it getting bumped and falling.I did a lot of research on 32" TV's for under $250 and this is one of the few major name brand units I found that had decent reviews.You will not be sorry with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Margaret Giardini
Reviews.Content: Received from Amazon a day early.  Set up was easy.  Setting up my DVD player was a challenge at first.  There is no yellow plug for the video.  What I did was plug it into one of the blue plugs above the audio until I had a picture with sound.  Also for INPUT, you have to make sure you change to Video or else you will have black and white, no color.  Once I put it on Video, it works great. Thanks to those who explained how to brighten the picture which by the way is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Grat TV for kids movie room
Reviews.Author: Hugo A. Gardea Rodriguez "HG"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our kid's TV room, we'll be hooked up to a regular slim DVD player and used for cartoons and such, so for the price and build quality, this is perfect, just be warned, it's and LCD, so it's bulky, don't expect LED thin, we knew that since the beggining so we can't complaint about that, image is good and since it's bulky, I guess that had room for decent speakers, not home theater speakers but way better than our other 55" LEDfor the main room, my phone has better speakers than that!! But for budget minded shoppers this is a great deal, I got for $270 and are very happy. If this is going to hang from your wall,  make sure to get a slim profile mount, otherwise it will stivk out too much from the wall...

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV...with a few minor flaws...
Reviews.Author: J. Hogan
Reviews.Content: My parents' old TV bit the dust, and they were looking for a 26" HDTV to replace it.  At the same time, there was a sale on this 32" Toshiba, and it was cheaper than the 26" TVs they were looking at, so they took my 26" Vizio, and bought this one in replacement.When it came a couple days later, I thought I had finally had my first mess up on Amazon, because the entire box and everything weighed less than the Vizio by itself.  Once I took it out of the box, I noticed that it had roughly the same depth as a typical LCD HDTV, but it was definitely much lighter.  It was a breeze to setup, and I had everything going in about 10 minutes.Pros:-Great picture.  The picture on this Toshiba is much better than I expected for an LCD.  Colors aren't over-saturated like on the Vizio, but yet aren't undersaturated either.  The blacks are very black as well, which surprised me considering it can't reach true black...more on that in a minute.-Like I mentioned before, it is considerably lighter than you would expect.  It's weight makes it a breeze to move around if you need to swap cables, or swap a room around.-REGZA-LINK!  This is an amazing feature that I absolutely love.  Sony and Samsung have technology built into their TVs and Blu-ray players that allows you to control your player with your TV remote.  Toshiba has the same tech in their TVs, but it works with ANY DVD/Blu-ray player connected over HDMI.  That way you only need one remote to change the volume and control your player.  It also recognizes when you turn on your Blu-ray player and switches inputs automatically.-Double Mute.  When you press the mute button, the volume doesn't completely mute, but instead, gets cut in half.Cons:-Only two HDMI ports.  It's understandable on a smaller HDTV, but I did expect for it to have three HDMI ports, so I'll be buying a switcher soon.-The blacks.  The TV is a little dark even with the backlight maxed out, but that's my opinion.  Not too dark where it's like the backlight is dead, but more like "cinematic" dark, so the good comes with the bad.-Double Mute.  Though it's a nice feature to have, you have to press the mute button twice to completely mute the TV, and once more to return it back to the previous volume.  I'm sure they could have programmed some sort of time delay so that you could press the mute button again and it return to normal volume.Hogan's Wrap-Up:I have throughly enjoyed this TV.  It is awesome to watch Blu-Rays on (I'm on a HUGE Big Bang Theory kick and I just bought Band of Brothers on Blu-ray to watch again), and my Xbox looks super sharp and crisp.  While I hate the lack of an extra HDMI, and the amazing blacks have a downside, they don't keep me from giving this TV a 5/5 at all!  I love it and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: I like Toshiba BUT
Reviews.Author: Robert Wolter
Reviews.Content: I have had Toshiba tvs for years and have recommended them to friends who are very happy with theirs.  Onething I like about Toshibas is they do not have a reflective screen which makes them good for brightly lit roomssuch as my family room.This unit however had a faint picture no matter how I adjusted the settings.  Had to send it back and havenot looked for another unit yet.  I will still consider Toshiba

Reviews.Title: Thank you Amazon
Reviews.Author: Maggie B
Reviews.Content: I had a 22 inch LCD in the room over the garage, and it works fine, but I found it hard to watch. Just too small for the room and my eyes. I searched for a replacement, starting with a low-priced ($199) Apex 32". This was decent for the money, but I had my doubts about longevity and service with an off-brand. The final straw was that I could not get it to work with a universal remote. That's a necessary convenience for me.Next up was an Insignia 40". It was too big for the space.I tried the Panasonic VIERA TC-L32C5 32-Inch. It was the right size and worked with the universal remote I have, but the picture was only mediocre, and the design very simple. The owners manual consists of 8 pages. For its size, this Panasonic is costly. You pay for the name.That brings me to the Toshiba. The picture is clear and crisp. The manual is 130 pages, showing plenty of features and adjustments. (Get it at [...]%2040E220U%20LCD%20HDTV%20Manual.pdf) The speakers are higher wattage than the Panasonic--10 watts vs 14 watts. The Rezga Link feature of this TV works with my internet enabled Sony Blue-Ray player that I got to watch Amazon Prime. That means the TV remote can control the Blu-ray player.I have had good service with Toshiba products I have purchased in the past, so I'm hoping if I have problems Toshiba will be there.The price here on Amazon beat the sale price for the Panasonic by $40+.So far this looks like a great choice!

Reviews.Title: Details.... I love the sleep timer!
Reviews.Author: eMac
Reviews.Content: I won't rehash what others have said- it's a great TV!I am writing this review just to add one detail that I look for, so perhaps it might matter to someone else:The remote does have a sleep timer button (my Vizio did not. It forced me to go through several menu steps to get to it- most annoying.)And, this TV's sleep timer has 10-minute increments! I love that. And it goes all the way up to, I think, 6 hours.I typically like to use the sleep timer both at night, for obvious reasons; and in the morning when I am getting ready for work. I like to set it to turn off a few minutes before I need to leave- a helpful reminder to get me out the door on time.Also, I'll add, as another reviewer mentioned- this TV does seem to pick up more OTA broadcast stations than others. My last 2 bedroom TVs did not pick up our local PBS station- despite my trying multiple antennas. This one does. Makes me happy!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive But Still Lacking
Reviews.Author: B Hector
Reviews.Content: My major complaint with this TV is how long it take to turn on. It's a good 5 seconds before the screen comes on.

Reviews.Title: Great Value Brand Name HDTV
Reviews.Author: David L. Vasser
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba model is a "5 Star Value" but I'm giving it a 4 star rating because it isn't the very best of the best 32-inch HDTV's out there, but good enough for my needs. Honestly for the money you can not beat this model.I also have the Toshiba 40 inch 1080p version of this same set which is about 9 months old and the great performance I've enjoyed with it is at least part of the reason I decided to go with this 32 inch 720p version for the bedroom.  I already had a ROKU HD box in the bedroom which is also 720p so the two are now working perfectly together.  If I bought a 1080p HDTV I'd feel like I needed to upgrade the ROKU also and thought I'd try this 720p TV instead figuring that really I'm not a big watch TV in bed guy.Before deciding I looked in person at this one and at 1080p 32 inch sets by two other good name brands that cost substantially more.  Really on the 32 inch sets at five feet away the difference between 720p and 1080p didn't make all that much difference and I just didn't see spending so much more money for so little benefit.  This set was to replace a non-HD CRT that was over a decade old so about anything would be an improvement.  If you must have the very best of everything you probably aren't reading reviews for this model anyway because it is not 1080p.Cons:720p not 1080p.  This is a big deal for some people, I found that to me it isn't such a big deal.Large frame around screen so it isn't as compact as other good brands with thin frames that cost a lot more.Remote sort of clunky but functional.Takes about 12 seconds to boot up.Channel changes are not instantaneous but lag about 2 seconds behind pushing the button.2 stage mute.  Push Mute button 1x and volume goes to 50%, push again and it mutes 100%.No WI-FI, SMART TV or built-in DVD/Blu-Ray, just a basic HDTV.Pros:Great picture for 720p with really good colors, no dead or stuck pixels.  Sharper than I expected.Surprisingly robust full range sound with no external sound accessories required.  A real strong point!Audio leveling tames blaring commercials but can be defeated in the setup menu if you want commercials to blare.Cheap!Good brand name.Easy to set up.Really sturdy fixed stand that also is stylish.Versatile compliment of inputs including 2 HDMI, 1 Coax, 1 Component, 1 Computer, 1 USB.Various format sound outputs, more of them than some other budget sets, including Dolby digital.Good build appearance that doesn't look like a cheapie.Low key green pilot light on front isn't overly distracting.No freaky or unpleasant odors.Fairly energy efficient with a $13 sticker on it.200x200 mounting pattern for wall mounts.All programmable & universal remotes (cable/satellite/etc) have TOSHIBA codes.Simple to set variable SLEEP timer.I shopped around quite a bit making lots of comparisons by "showrooming" several stores.  I decided on this one and waited for a sale.  Amazon and a local Big Box had the same sale price for President's Day but I went with Amazon because of no sales tax.  That way I could get the extended warranty for about the same cost as the TV alone at the local Big Box.  My only concern then was having to return it if damaged or malfunctioning but I know from experience Amazon is great to worth with on returns.The set arrived on time with my free 2-day Prime Member shipping.  The box had a huge gouge in one side but the TV itself was fine so the box did what it should.  Stand assembly on these takes about 3 minutes or less and requires only a Phillips head screw driver and a smooth flat surface like a bed or sofa where you can lay the display face down with the bottom hanging over the edge in order to attach the stand and secure the 4 included screws.When you first power it up it will boot to a screen that asks you to choose between HOME or RETAIL mode.  I chose HOME and then it did a channel scan which took at least 5 minutes and then was ready to go.I found the tip about turning off the automatic brightness function last summer on these Toshibas.  Turning the auto brightness off does perk up the picture and make the colors vivid.  Turning this feature off makes it look like it does in the store in "retail" mode.  Turning off the auto brightness does make the display run at 100% all the time so it uses slightly more energy and I suspect it also may shorten backlight life, but still if you find the picture too dark or colors too dim this is a tip worth trying so I'm repeating it here:1. Press MENU.2. Scroll Right to PREFERENCES.3. Scroll down BEYOND the bottom of the visible menu to find ENERGY SAVING SETTINGS and press enter.4. Press RIGHT control once to turn Auto Brightness Sensor to OFF.5. Press MENU and press Menu a second time to exit menu.  Done.Under PICTURE category in menu settings I suggest you leave the DYNALIGHT function "ON" as this is completely different from the Auto Brightness function.  Dynalight improves contrast and it looks slightly better to me with it turned on, which is the default setting.  This is especially true on night scenes or any scene with lots of dark colors such as an old black & white film.Also under the PICTURE category on the main menu I set this one to DYNAMIC mode and it looks great with no other video adjustments at all.  All the video settings were left at the default except I turned the Automatic Brightness off and set the mode to DYNAMIC.Next I adjusted the sound EQ and set the bass to +8 and the treble to +2.  It sounds amazingly good for watching movies or normal TV shows. Dialog is crystal clear and music sounds ok.  Some 32 and even 40 inch TV's have weak sound and leave you wanting more, but both my Toshibas have great sound and don't need any external sound augmentation for normal movies or TV shows.  I think Toshiba's sound is way above average because bad sounding or weak audio is a frequent complaint, even with some other good brand names.I really like this 32 inch HDTV in my bedroom.  I'd buy this exact model again, especially when it is on sale.  I really shopped around and I don't think you can do better with a top name HDTV for the money.  I looked at some cheaper ones too.  I liked this one better than the cheaper ones and better than some of the more expensive ones.  Again my previous good experience with my 40 inch Toshiba weighed heavily in my decision.

Reviews.Title: Good Solid Television
Reviews.Author: Thomas Marks
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my Wife's craftroom for Christmas.  She didn't want a 1080 HD so I looked through the discounted 720p 32" LCD televisions.  I had it narrowed down to this Toshiba model and a Samsung.  The Toshiba had several good reviews not only about the picture quality but the sound as well - so I bought it.Other reviewers have commented on the picture quality and what settings to use to get the best picture.  Apparently, it you leave it on an eco power saving setting, the picture looks washed out.  I followed their advice and did get a good picture.  Eventhough this TV is a 720, it does have good color and picture clarity.What I like about this TV is:- It's light weight.  I mounted it on a wall mount that swivels.  I was able to lift it onto the mount very easily.- It has 2 HDMI connections plus several others; I've since plugged my wife's computer into the television and will also connect it to a Directv receiver.- The genaric wall mount fit the TV with no problems.- Amazon discounted this TV to a good price.I really can't think of any negatives so I will recommend this television as a good solid purchase at the discounted price.

Reviews.Title: Quality of Picture Poor
Reviews.Author: Orin W. Holland "Wayne"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a number of different flat-screen TV's including Samsung and Vizio.  All of these met my expectations as far as video quality.  The Toshiba did not.  I spent a lot of time trying to adjust the color, contrast, etc. but the picture always looked a bit fuzzy and dim.  I would not buy Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: Get Your Game On.Hardcore Gamer.Input lag (-)Color(+)
Reviews.Author: PrimitivePrime
Reviews.Content: OK people.At first thought when this tv is first turned on the colors are dark and ok at best.However I already knew this by reviewing this TV.You must turn the energy saver settings to off!After the engery settings is off,this TV POPS with beautiful color.I use this TV for hardcore Gaming and streaming movies with the PS3.First off the most important desire was for this TV to have little to no input lag.This TV shows it has a gaming setting that will reduce input lag so that got my attention.After reading up on this TV,I still didn't see really any information on how to put this tv in game mode for the quick,clean,crisp screen action a hardcore gamer desires.I will tell you I am more than pleased with this TV capabilities to display that much wanted clear picture speed with little to NO input lag.Understand I'm not a retailer ,seller of this brand name Nor do I care what brand it is.results is what I was after.This TV fits the bill!!I'm a hardcore gamer that likes to watch movies with the wife and be inside the game when Its my turn to burn!I also like the quick screen display size action to blow up the(+) aim site cross hair while gaming.This setting gives me a bigger target to shoot..lol..Best picture with The ps3 was to use HDMI and go into output settings for TV in the PS3 and manually turn on 1080p.Only check the 1080p box.For me this gave me the crisp clean bright look for gaming I have been searching for!!Hope this helps for you gamers searching for a TV that will give you the clear advantage of that wide screen 1080p HDTV with little input lag..If your wandering which games I play mostly with the PS3 and this TV its Socom Confrontation PSN Primitiveprime text me via PSN for more info if wanted.Cheers

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32-inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Dawn N. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV even after looking at the other reviews. Our son has a Toshiba Laptop that he has had for 5 years and no problems, so I decided to give the Toshiba TV a try. What a mistake! The TV looked nice but once it was set-up and turned on the problem started. I could never get the picture to ever become bright enough on all of my television channels. What a disappointment! After watching for 1 hour and trying to make some adjustments (which never helped) I boxed the TV back up, printed up a return label and took it to UPS to be returned. I immediately went to a local store and purchased the Samsung TV that I had originally planned on. I took the Samsung home set it up and am loving it. I hope Toshiba will read this review and the other ones that have been left and fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Power went out 1 1/2 years after purchase
Reviews.Author: djc
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for Christmas of 2010.  this summer it simply would not come on.  no storms in the area. no power surges.  took the back off and replaced the fuse that was blown. plugged it in fuse blew immediately.  $379 for a tv that lasted a year.  Never will I buy a Toshiba again.  I googled it and this is not an uncommon problem.

Reviews.Title: Good buy but instruction manual is poor
Reviews.Author: Linda Thompson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv on March 1, 2013.  The tv works great but the print on the instructions is so small we had to use a magnifying glass to read some of it.  Also, there are no instructions for customizing your tv settings.  We finally figured out how to hook up our DVD player to the tv, but we could not get color.  Nothing in the instructions addressed this.  We finally had to call customer support, and they walked us through several steps to customize the tv so that we could get the DVD in color and set the screen settings.  None of these things are addressed in the instruction manual.  Needs more detail and larger print in the instruction manual.

Reviews.Title: no one talks about channel tuning speed
Reviews.Author: J. Scott Scaggs
Reviews.Content: Sure the picture is good, and the price was more than reasonable.But the thing that disappoints me about this TV is how long it takes to tune cable channels, taking all the fun out of channel surfing. I've timed it as taking 3.2 seconds to go from one channel to the next. (For reference sake, it's connected directly to a coaxial cable with the signal coming from Time Warner Cable,) The other TVs in the house tune channels almost instantly.This Toshiba also takes 15.7 seconds to turn on, from the time I hit the power button to the time it takes to tune the first channel. The other thing to be aware of is how small the onscreen data is. So if you're sitting farther than about 7-8 feet away, it may be a challenge to read the channel number, favorites list, etc.But in all fairness, the picture and sound are just fine.

Reviews.Title: Spot on for the Price.
Reviews.Author: Sounds
Reviews.Content: Remeber when HDTV were thousands upon thousands of dollars. Well those days are gone as this technology becomes the norm in  the common household. I purchased the Toshiba confidently due to my past experiences with their products and with the sale price of 219.00 I could not pass up the offer. This unit will be used mostly by the inlaws in the spare bedroom but I had to give it a test run.The Pros:1) Great 720 picture.2) Surpisingly good sound3) 2HDMI ports4) Optional HD CPU portThe Cons:1) Small remote; like if this remote was a guy he would never use a community shower kinda small. Like if...well I guess you got the point.2) Lack luster menu but it is functional.So all in all a great purchase for the price.See Ya, Sounds

Reviews.Title: Hooked it up... no picture.
Reviews.Author: Caleb Ward
Reviews.Content: Got my Toshiba television. Took it out of the box and it looked great. Nice style and design. Plugged it in and powered it on. I see the Toshiba logo as its powering on, then I see a black screen. Took a little closer look and I could see the shadow of the menu box. Tinkered with it for a while and finally got fed up. Called Toshiba. Great customer service. Pretty much told me this happens often and its a hardware problem with the screen. Yet to get my replacement from amazon. Maybe that will change my mind.

Reviews.Title: problems
Reviews.Author: Jim Foyer
Reviews.Content: I sent the first unit back because the remote had trouble talking to the television set. We received a replacement and have installed that, however the problem still exists. I believe it's an inherent fault in all their TV sets and there's no sense in going further with it. We'll just live with what we have but we're not happy.I would never recommend this product to anyone under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: curtis abbe "happy camper"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV since July 9th & I got to say that at first I did have a problem with the sound like other reviewers stated up till about 2 weeks ago that is,I knew that there were sound problems going into this.So I was messing with the cable connection on the back of the TV went to change the channel,it scared the crap out of me when I got on the station it was like SO LOUD it blew my ears off (it was on 100 by the way). I do not know what I did to get the sound to sound like it should but I do  not have any qualms with the sound anymore.Now that the sound has been "solved" I  never have it higher than 10-15 on most days.The PC connection works as good as it should as well as everything esle even though I do not have a BLU RAY yet the rca's work well on this set.The HD cable box really increases the boldness & the vibrancy of the colors.The picture is just as good as any high end Tv in my opinionOverall,I am very pleased with my purchase from AmazonI would recommend this TV to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Dead Pixel!
Reviews.Author: PMcOuntry "PMcOuntry"
Reviews.Content: I love Toshiba TV's. My father has had a similar model (older) for years and has never had any problems. I took this out of the box and it was spectacular viewing from the start. However, I didn't use the the TV right away or very often and when I finally got my new Blu-Ray player I noticed a small issue. A red dot. A dead/stuck pixel. I went online and searched for ways to fix it. Since it's red, it's simply a stuck pixel, and not dead. Nothing worked. I was very upset and contacted customer service. They said my 30 days were up?! I was devastated. I had to save up my money to buy this TV to replace an old CTR that was on the verge of death. However, good news! They finally agreed to refund my money, I assured them I did not want a refund, but a replacement. I love the TV, I just don't want a defective one. They immediately processed my return for 1 day shipping and I will receive my new TV on Tuesday. I couldn't be happier with Amazon Customer Service right now. Once I receive the new TV I will be sure to update this review. I appear to be the only one who has had this problem with this set (that is my luck though!). My only advice to buyers looking at this TV right now is, it's a great TV, but be sure to check it as soon as you take it out of the box! Lesson learned!I got the new TV and set it up. No dead pixels on this set, but I'm keeping a close eye on it for the next 30 days!

Reviews.Title: Good basic TV
Reviews.Author: Only Brian
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 6 weeks so far, and I am very satisfied with this purchase, especially for the price (I got it for $229, its price as of writing is $249).  The picture quality seems great, and the speakers are decent as well; no distorted sound at normal volume, though I can't say I'm as picky as some about sound.  One odd thing about the sound is that the mute button has to be pressed twice to completely mute it.  The first time it's pressed it turns the volume down halfway, then mutes it completely on the second button press.  This isn't necessarily a con, just out of the ordinary and something to be aware of.A few reviews voiced complaints about the difficulty of assembling the stand, but I personally had no problems there.  I was able to use a small screwdriver on a swiss army knife, although a regular screwdriver with a longer shaft admittedly would have made it easier.  It's possible that they have changed the stand since those reviews were written.This is a pretty basic TV, so there isn't much else I can say about amazing features or anything, other than just about everything works fine and it seems like a good quality device.  Which is exactly why I bought this TV, rather than a cheaper off-brand one.  I personally don't need anything beyond the basics right now, just something that looks good and does the job.  As long as it continues to work well for a long time, I'm happy.  There are just a couple things that could be better.The settings are intuitive and easy to navigate, as are the buttons on the remote.  However, when turning the TV on, it seems to be extremely particular about the vertical and horizontal angle the remote is held at.  I often have to hit the power button several times from different angles before the power light comes on.  I don't have this problem with any other buttons on the remote, even the power button works fine when turning it off, so I'm not entirely sure whether it is just a defect with mine or not.The last issue I had was that the picture was pretty dark out of the box, and it was almost impossible to see images in darker scenes.  Fortunately, this is easily remedied by upping the backlight and turning off the energy savings mode.  A helpful review by Mark Fellows cited another reviewer's explanation of how to do this, so if you are wondering how to change those settings, check that out.  After changing this, I had no complaints about the picture.I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good quality device that looks and sounds good, but has few extra features.  Works great for my needs.

Reviews.Title: perfect for dormrooms
Reviews.Author: Collegestudent
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student looking for a screen for my xbox and laptop. This fit the bill perfectly. It is light, efficient, easy to set up and cheap. Perfect for dorm rooms.

Reviews.Title: Great Value - No longer too dark
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: Great value for a 32 inch TV.  Initially thought it was too dark, the picture wasn't bright enough even with back lighting turned all the way up. Solution: Menu > Preferences > Energy Savings Settings (keep pressing down, it's not initially shown on the menu) > Auto Brightness Sensor > Off

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture.  Well worth the price.
Reviews.Author: Carabele "C LaH"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!  The pic is wonderfully clear and setup is fairly easy.  The sound is really pretty good for an HD television, though at some point I imagine I will get a sound bar to augment it.I did turn off the Energy Saving picture thing, as many other people commented about.  And yes, channel-changing is a bit slow, but it's not a problem from my viewpoint as I don't have "itchy clicky fingers".

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: gharley
Reviews.Content: Have had the TV for a couple of weeks now and I have absolutely nothing negative to report about it. Great picture, all picture & audio adjustments are easy to adjust through the menu's. Other reviews mentioned the sound quality being poor. I guess if your trying to get super hi fi I could agree with those points of view BUT the sound quality is great as long as your not trying to blast the windows out. Doh! I run the picture setting on 1080i through DirectTV satellite service. Works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Beverly J. Rusling
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my granddaughter's room and it's very good. Good picture quality on satellite and works perfectly in her 12X12 bedroom. If you want to setup a media center though, keep on looking. This set is short on needed connections to operate everything from your remote...

Reviews.Title: Works Well for Small Rooms
Reviews.Author: John Jesensky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in need of a slim TV for the bedroom of our new apartment.  We just didn't have the space for the chunky late 90's projection TV that we used to use.We opted for this TV mainly because it was small enough to not hurt our eyes in a small room, and the price was good.  We mainly use it to relax for 30 minutes or so before bed, and then it goes off.  Would I suggest this TV for a giant living room meant to entertain a hoard of movie-loving friends?  No way.  You can do much better than that for only a little more money.  But it suited our needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: buy the Samsung instead, works awesome
Reviews.Author: JLakin
Reviews.Content: Worked good for about 4 months. Then nothing... It wouldn't do a thing. No power, picture, sound.. Nothing.Trouble returning it too.

Reviews.Title: The speakers suck
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: You can hear the TV great if you are behind it, but the speakers have no volume.. it sound on it sucks

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS BRAND
Reviews.Author: PL
Reviews.Content: DISAPPOINTED BOUGHT THIS ON RECOMMENDATIONS BUT WAS EXTREMELY DISAPPPOINTED WITH THE PRODUCT ESPECIALLY THE POOR SOUND QUALITY AND REMOTE FOR THIS TV.  RETURNED.

Reviews.Title: TV goes black with noise
Reviews.Author: Dongmyun M. Lee
Reviews.Content: Bought this about a year ago.  A nice thing about this TV is bulit-in HD digital antenna.  It was hooked up with Charter cable without HD settop. The broadcasting channels are showing clear crisp images of HD quality.  The problem is the TV goes black with some noise by itself, then later power came back on.  I do not keep track of how often it happens but the frequency seems to be increasing. I think it is a power control circuit reliability issue, perhaps faulty or leaky capacitor, like the case of samsung TC class action.  Am afraid it might breakdown soon.

Reviews.Title: Died One Day Past Warranty
Reviews.Author: T Walker
Reviews.Content: Actually it made it 11 months (12 month parts and labor warranty) and then went black.  It is most likely not worth the time and energy to return it.  Sad.

Reviews.Title: piece of JUNK
Reviews.Author: Alison Berry
Reviews.Content: Bought for guest room 1 year ago, only used about 3 times, will not power on, absolute piece of JUNK!

Reviews.Title: Horrible, a real lemon
Reviews.Author: D. C.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item months ahead of time as a Mother's Day Gift for my mother. Unfortunately, we didn't hook it up until Mother's Day and it's too late to return it.  The picture is dull and faded.  No matter how you change the settings, you can't get the picture to appear sharp or bright.  Horrible TV.  Also, the sound goes out approx. once every hour for a few seconds.  It's not the cable company, we checked.  It's the TV.  I called Toshiba and they said it sounded like a hardware problem and we can take it to be repaired.  The problem is that my mother is unable to do this on her own and I don't live near her (I also don't drive).  I guess at some point we'll try to follow up with the repairs, but I don't know how much is covered by the warranty.  I doubt they will be able to fix it to appear any better anyway.  I have a Sony Bravia which I purchased around the same time.  It's worth spending the extra money.  As they say, you get what you pay for......

Reviews.Title: Great picture( with a few tweaks) great price
Reviews.Author: big lar "creative thinker"
Reviews.Content: Like I said great picture and price. Needs a few tweaks to give you an even better than factorysettings, as indicated in several fine comments from others. In case you missed that. Turn off the auto bright sensor. I found the following EXTREMELY HELPFUL TIP ON A BEST BUY REVIEW posted by USofANDY."The picture looks excellent, however, I did need to make a lot of changes to the menu settings to achieve this - the picture is too dark at default settings but the two key settings to remedy this are the energy saver settings and backlight intensity.Turn off energy saving and crank up the backlight and you have a very bright picture, the remaining settings can be easily calibrated to your preference.Make no mistake, I love the picture quality and the screen itself has low reflection."I am really glad I found that tip by chance, and I hope you find the tip either on Best Buy, or here on Amazon.James Ruffin Says:"1. Hit the menu button,2.go to "preferences" in the menu3. press the down arrow key to scroll down (the energy settings are sort of hidden at the bottom),3. hit the enter button to select energy savings4. Set auto brightness sensor to "off"Picture should be much brighter. "Hope you like your set as much as I do mine. Thanks guys for the great tips I have quoted here, I could'thave done it without you. Just another reason I am a confirmed Amazon customer.

Reviews.Title: Not a good TV
Reviews.Author: larry
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this product,the first one did not work and Amazon replaced it.The new one worked for about 2 months now it went out.Save your money and buy a different brand.Will never buy a Toshiba TV again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Rick Blaine "Ten 252"
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV for a couple of weeks but so far everything looks great. Just keep in mind that this is a 720P resolution set and as such the picture will not be quite as sharp as you're used to on a large 1080P or 1080I TV. Most of the 4/5 star reviews on here give all of the best reasons for getting this set but I'd just like to add that you have to watch the price on here very carefully. I paid $239, the next day it was $229 and a week later the price jumped to $339 for a day!! Less than $250 is a great price, over $300 is not. At $339 add a few bucks and get a Samsung 1080p.

Reviews.Title: So far; LOVE THIS!!
Reviews.Author: A big Fan
Reviews.Content: It was very inexpensive. The shipping was fast! The screen is clear. The sound is fine. It can get pretty loud. The size is a tade bit larger then others but it doesn't matter much. Stand is stable. Has a super easy set up. No problems so far. Get deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Pick
Reviews.Author: Tracey Murillo
Reviews.Content: I shipped this item to my son whom is in the AF, he did not have a TV in his dorm. This was the first TV he has seen since Oct 2012. He was not allowed to watch TV while in basic military training, then after he completed tech school he was transferred to spokane, WA and had no TV in his dorm. So as a surprise to him I purchased this item and it was a wonderful gift. The shipping was on time, they informed me every step of the way until it arrived to the base. He received it PERFECT shipping condition, and he has enjoyed it very much. So I would like to thank Amazon for such great service. Thank- you once again!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D. Robert
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a replacement tv for a fairly large room that is not used daily.  I questioned the purchase based on some peoples concerns on volume.  this is a great TV.  I see no issue with volume or picture.  The quality is better than some of the other LED tvs we have in the house.  Picture is fantastic, very true to life.

Reviews.Title: Crystal Clarity
Reviews.Author: William T. Burke
Reviews.Content: Blu-Ray and Video Games are awesome.Regular TV is amazing I have no complaints just praises.I highly recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loved it, but....
Reviews.Author: Permit Clerk
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She loved it, but after a month the screen got a black line down the middle. We called Amazon and they immediately sent out a new one! She said the picture is clear and is very happy with it. So far all is well with the new one. I did buy an extended warranty and glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Andrew Summers
Reviews.Content: When we first recieved it their were some yellow pixels but that could have been just a bad panel not Amazons fault Toshiba took responsibility and fixed it works great has some nice features and good clean picture and received it for a great price first Toshiba Tv we ever owned but would highly recommend if you are looking for something mid range basic with a good picture and easy features. One more thing use Mark Fellows review in the Amazon review section to improve experience very good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, excellent price,
Reviews.Author: R. L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I received the set one day early by FedEx, excellent condition. easy assembly. The picture is what I expected, clear and bright. The only negative I can think of, and maybe its just me, the volume doesnt seem that loud, compared to the RCA 32in; I purchased in January. Love that set too! I hooked a DVD player to the Toshiba and had little lines in the picture, didnt like that, so I plugged the video wire into a different port, then cleared the lines, but now its in black and white. Its not the TV's fault. The TV in antenna mode has great color and picture, so it has to be in the DVD player. I would buy againUpdate: I have had this TV a couple of weeks. worked fine, then started to act up, wouldnt change to other channels, just toggle between 2 channels. so I called Toshiba hotline for advice, He walked me thru the channel setup and it was fine. very good tech support. I should have just tried on my own, but now at least its recorded at Toshiba in case any other issue comes up. still havent got the Black and White DVD player issue, going to try different cables.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for a 32inch TV
Reviews.Author: erin
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV on amazon for $199 and it has been a great TV.  The color is great and sounds is great too.  For under $200 I dont think you can beat this one.

Reviews.Title: broken right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Mort
Reviews.Content: hooked it up and the screen was messed up and had lines running up and down the left side of the TV. but the great part was the ease of returning the item .the whole process was pain less. thank you amazon.I still buy from you fro that reason and the great buys. thanks Mort

Reviews.Title: Great product, suits gamers and casual TV watchers
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 32" model on 1/2/13 at $225, having paid for two-day shipping.Initially, I was debating between this Toshiba model and a Panasonic, because I was reading conflicting reviews on both brands and couldn't decide. After researching both options, I went with the Toshiba that I believed was only 720p capable.It arrived (as always with amazon) right on time at my door on Friday the 4th. Setup was simple - had to attach the stand to the tv itself with a philips head screwdriver. However, the picture out of the box was horrid. I had to go into picture settings and turn Dynalight on, which brightened the picture right up. I also adjusted the tv to the following, to give it more clarity:Contrast 75; Backlight 95; DynaLight On; Brightness 60; Color 70; Tint 0 and Sharpness 15.People looking to buy this for console gaming: When I setup my 360 with the HDMI cord, you have the option to play up to 1080p, which was a complete surprise to me. I had thought this was only a 720p max resolution tv.Audio: Not tinny at all. In my room at night, I had the volume down to 1 and it was still very audible. Between 10-15 volume, I could hear voices and sfx effects about 40' away as clearly as if I was sitting in my bedroom with the TV. I don't believe you can hook up external speakers, but they aren't necessary in a small/medium size bedroom.Viewing: I sit 5' away from the screen when gaming/watching TV in HD (have to pay for high definition channels)and honestly see no difference between the two resolutions. The viewing angles: from the left side, the picture loses it's contrast and is very bright. I suggest staying in front of the TV at least 4' away to see the best results.Overall: TV is an all-around suitor for gamers, people looking to watch sports/casual TV in standard OR high definition, and finally, makes for the perfect PC monitor.

Reviews.Content: I was able to pick this up for $199 and it was definitely a bargain at that price point. No dead or stuck pixels, excellent HD quality reception with local over the air channels, and I was able to hook up my son's Wii with no problems. You are able to hook up a non-component video input like the Wii, you just need to set the input options from component video. I found the following online ...Open the main menu and select the preferences section. This is the third section. Find the setting called "AV Input," and change it from "ColorStream HD" to "Video." Note that I'm not suggesting you change what input you have the TV using currently (by hitting the INPUT button); I'm asking you to let the TV know what it should look for through those ports (a composite device, not a component device).

Reviews.Title: Happy Returns!
Reviews.Author: Starfishin "Starfishin"
Reviews.Content: Bought this because of the price, and the strong reviews. Hooked it up with an HDMI cable, and followed the advice posted here regarding changing the color settings. Still, the colors were kind of muted -- disappointing, but not a deal breaker. After a week or so, though,  a solid black box started popping up in the middle of the screen.  It would disappear if I turned the tv off and back on, but since it was still under full warranty w/free return shipping I decided to exchange it.What a difference in the replacement tv! Right out of the box the colors were bright and crisp -- didn't even need to change the settings. I think there must be some sort of quality control problem with these tvs that accounts for those purchasers who report color problems.  I would advise anyone who buys this set and has color problems to not settle for muted colors, and exchange it right away. This set should have a bright, crisp picture.I agree with those who complain that the top volume is not very loud.  Over the past few weeks I've been traveling for work, and have encountered about a dozen new tvs of various makes and sizes. The max volume on all of them was not what I would consider loud (not loud enough for everyone in a good-sized conference room to easily hear, for example.) A colleague suggested that they're now being made that way in order to encourage people to buy external speakers.  Maybe so -- but I wonder if it's really because they are using cheaper internal speakers that can't handle what used to be considered a normal loud volume. Either way, the volume issue seems to cut across brands, and is not particular to this tv.

Reviews.Title: Very nice television, but there are some hitches
Reviews.Author: Eric Whitehead "ewleonardspock"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice television, but it does have some hitches.Pros:It's nice and big.It has great picture quality.It wasn't very expensive.It supports 1080p in that it converts it down to 720p.Cons:It's not 1080p (although I knew that going in).It doesn't have a lot of inputs (One shared Composite video and component video input).There were issues with the color at certain resolutions (I'll explain that more below).You have to fumble with a lot of the settings to get it working just right.As for the color issues.  The problem can be almost exclusively attributed to Microsoft Windows.  When I connect my Mac to the television over HDMI, the color is just fine.  Windows on the other hand, had a lot of issues with this tv.  When I connected the PC up to it originally (it's a Dell Studio Hybrid running Windows 7 by the way), I had to fumble around with a bunch of settings in Windows just to find a resolution that worked with the TV.  When I finally found one that fit properly and started a movie, I noticed that portions of the picture that were really bright yellow (almost white) actually came out lime green.  After spending an unreasonable amount of time messing with Windows trying to get into advanced video settings I just gave up and used a 3rd party program that let me manually manipulate values in the registry.  Even this didn't work though.  I could make the green go away, but as a result the image was overly dark and difficult to see.  I eventually decided to try it with my old Windows 7 laptop.  Running at the same resolution, I saw the green spots, so I went into the advanced video controls on the laptop (the laptop has a fancy-ish Nvidia video card so I there was a nice Nvidia control panel that gave me options Windows didn't seem to) and found the color panel (I forget exactly what it's called now), one of the settings was to change the color from RGB to YPrPb (or something like that) which fixed the problem with the green spots, but back on the Dell, there was no such option because it has a generic Intel integrated graphics chipset thing.  I finally managed to convince Windows to listen to reason and show me all of the available resolutions (one of which was normal 720p).  Once I changed it to that, the problem went away.  So moral of the story, make sure you have any computer running Windows set to either 720p or 1080p because Windows won't give you any of the options necessary in order to make the color problem go away on other resolutions.Also, for the settings on the TV, I recommend turning the automatic brightness and dynalight settings off, because they're useless.  I don't actually know which one was causing the problem, but whenever I had the fluorescent lights in my dorm room turned on, it looked like the image was flickering.As a final opinion, if you know what you're doing, you have a Mac or Linux machine or are not afraid to show Windows who's boss, and you don't need a whole lot of inputs other than HDMI, this is a great TV.  Once I got past the coloring problem it was smooth sailing, I haven't had to mess with much else since.

Reviews.Title: Nice to see all the action with a great picture as well
Reviews.Author: B. Nelson
Reviews.Content: This is our first LCD flat screen TV, so keeping that in mind here's our review. We've had this TV for approx 6 months and it works wonderfully. In researching these types of TVs I considered the size of our living room and how close we'd be to the device. We have a small living room so a large LCD was not what we wanted, this 32" size  works well for our needs. We enjoy movies and some broadcast shows, but we didn't want a large TV to dominate the room and thought it'd be like sitting in a front row at the movies, bigger is not always better. Also we are not video addicted to a point that we must have a 1080p over a 720p, in looking at LCD's of each didn't seem to be that much different to me. Also, technology these days upgrades every few months (right now LED's are all the rage) and you never catch up unless you have a bottomless bank account. Toshiba has had consistent good ratings for quality and it was so nice to when Toshiba 32C120U went on sale.The picture is very clear and there is a night and day difference between the old 100 lbs TV's and these, it seems though only a 32" model the picture is larger than that which is nice. Also, it is great to see all the action as well and especially all the characters with the HD letter box format without that squished down, shrunken picture feeling when watching on a square TV. The audio is average though, as this is not a larger TV and as thin and light as it is there doesn't seem to be much effort by most of these companies put in even above average sound. So if that is important to you or it will be the only sound you'll use for TV viewing, then maybe a bigger model would be better or start saving to add a sound bar or system to it. You of course get a remote and lots of menus to figure in setting up your viewing which is fairly self explanatory. OH, and make sure you know where it is at all time as this model does not have buttons on the actual device, without the remote you don't operate the TV unless you've programed it into another remote, say for Sat dish or cable. We found though that even programmed with the DirectTV remote we still need the Toshiba TV remote to switch to the DVD player and back. We are pleased with the quality and the price of this Toshiba and if you're looking for a smaller size in LCD I would recommend this.

Yeah there's a little lag because it is digital, but the big boy TV switches channels twice as fast as this one.Second, like I said, I have a bigger 1080p Toshiba I bought about six years ago before prices came crashing down (if only I had waited four months...). Anyway, in that time, Toshiba STILL can't seem to put a "dash" button on the remote. I don't want to enter channel 8, then press the up button to get to 8-1. The cheap Dynex in the bedroom even has this basic feature. I would think that with digital being a requirement in the U.S. now that this would be a standard feature on TVs, but I guess not.Other than that it is a good TV. It has a few HDMI inputs, component, etc. Not a ton, but then again, this is not a home theater TV so I am not going to expect that.

Reviews.Title: VG Pictiure when light sensor is modified
Reviews.Author: Jon   Farmington,  MO
Reviews.Content: I bought this  Toshiba 32C120U 32-Inch 720p 60Hz LCD HDTV (Black)used Amazon site as VG condition. At first, I was very upset about the brightness in my living room where the lights above are usually off day and night. No further adjustments on the brightness contrast, backlight , would give much help. That day was cloudy and little light was coming through the near window. I was going to send it back and even got a return RMA shipment tag.  Then the next day I turned on the above lights with a Lumens of 2400. Low and behold..the picture slowly got brighter and brighter where I had to actually turn down the brightness on the TV. I tend to be creative, and I thought if I could get more light into the sensor, (next to the on-off light) it should get even brighter. so I got a little flexible mirror that would re-direct the above lights directly into the sensor. After a few adjustments, again it got even brighter.  So, I wish that a company that installs the light sensor to conserve energy, allow the owner to decide about energy consumption instead of literally forcing it on the consumer. Now instead of giving it one star, it gets 4 stars. it would get 5 if the sensor was deleted. Also VG sound with 4 stars.
